text: While it's commendable that some zoos and aquariums have improved their standards, it's crucial to consider whether the benefits of captivity outweigh the costs to the animals. Studies have shown that even in well-maintained facilities, animals can suffer from captivity-related stress, health issues, and behavioral abnormalities. For example, orcas in captivity often display aggressive behaviors and have significantly shorter lifespans compared to their wild counterparts. These negative impacts raise ethical concerns about the morality of keeping animals in artificial environments
